info.title: Platform_administration
info.description: Unified OpenAPI specification for platform_administration domain

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **plan**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; **addon**: for SMS, staff_seats and other SKUs.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The underlying SKU, can be a code name of a package, a code name of an app or a code name of an addon like SMS or staff_seat. If not specified, all SKUs are returned

parameters.name: directory_uid
parameters.description: A specific directory mentioned by its unique identifier

parameters.name: payment_type
parameters.description: The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering,**external**: Payment is not done by the platform (typically an API call from the partner), **free**: No payment is required; **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering; **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis; **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis; **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscription

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: How many items to return per page

parameters.name: is_active
parameters.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **plan**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; **SMS**: For text message offerings; **staff_seat** For additional business seats.

parameters.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **plan**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; **SMS**: For text message offerings; **staff_seat**: For additional business seats.

parameters.description: A specific offering mentioned by its unique identifier

get.description:
List all Subscriptions in scope.

Available for **Staff Tokens**

post.description:
Create a new Subscription for a business. Supports discounted and free plans using coupons.

**Coupon Support:**
- Use the `price` parameter to override the standard offering price (restricted to directory/admin tokens only)
- Provide `coupon_code` to apply a discount identifier for Recurly integration
- Provide `discount_code_name` to track the discount type (e.g., 'percent', 'fixed_amount')
- When `price` is provided, `payment_type` must be set to 'external'
- When a 100% discount is applied (price = 0), checkout will be skipped
- The system stores both `original_price` (from the offering) and `price` (the discounted amount) for reporting

Available for **Directory, Staff, and internal Tokens**

Create multiple Subscriptions for a business.

Available for **internal Tokens**

business_cart_uid.description: The unique identifier of the BusinessCart to process and create Subscriptions for

201.description: The newly created list of Subscriptions

Retrieve a Subscription by its unique identifier.

Available for **Directory, Staff, app, and internal Tokens**

put.description:

get.description: Search for a business by external_reference_id or email. A filter is required for the API to return a result.

parameters.description: Filter by email specified (make sure its URL-encoded)
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Filter by "external_id" specified. **Deprecate**. This will still work, but for new implementation please use external_reference_id.
parameters.name: external_id

200.description: Business Created. When 'synchronized' is true (default), the response includes the complete business data. When 'synchronized' is false, the response is returned immediately after validation and the business creation is processed asynchronously. In the asynchronous case, the final result will be delivered via webhook: success notifications are sent to subscribers of the 'business' entity with event_type 'create', and failure notifications are sent to subscribers of the 'account' entity with event_type 'rejected'.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. The request contains invalid or missing required fields, validation errors, or business name contains invalid terms.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

409.description: Conflict - A business with the provided email or external_reference_id already exists.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

country_name.description: Businesss Country. Must be a valid country name

display_name.description: Owners display name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines (if not provided, FIRST NAME + LAST NAME will be used)

email.description: Owner's email, also used as the business's main email

first_name.description: Owners first name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

language.description: One of en,es,fr,it,pt,de,pl,nl,en-GB. Default determined by Directory

last_name.description: Owners last name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

address.description: Business address. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

business_category.description: The business main occupation. Must be a valid business category

business_maturity_in_years.description: Business maturity in years. Valid value is one of [null, 0, 0.5, 0.5-2, 2+]

hide_address.description: Whether to show the business address to clients

landing_page.description: Deprecated - Previously used for marketing purposes, up to 255 characters

logo_url.description: Business logo URL - A valid image URL. Supporting formats: jpg, jpeg, gif, png, SVG. Make sure the URL includes one of these extensions

name.description: Business name. Up to 100 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

short_description.description: Short description of the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

time_zone.description: Time zone name from MAPPING object found in: https://api.rubyonrails.org/v4.2.3/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html, Default value is determined by the Directory

website_url.description: Business's website URL. Must be a valid URL address including http/https.

google_client_id.description: Google Analytics ID to be embedded in the client portal, helping businesses to track their clients using Google Analytics. Must be a valid ID from Google

mixpanel_id.description: Mixpanel ID for mixpanel integration (up to 80 characters). Matching pattern tracking of business actions

audit.description: For internal tracking of business actions. Format: [{'action' => 'action_name','context' => {'key' => 'value'}}]

external_id.description: Legacy, replaced by external_reference_id. It may also be referred to as a 'nickname'. Must contain at least one lowercase letter, can include numbers, and dots, at least 5 characters long, platform unique

external_reference_id.description: Unique id that represents the business in the partners systems

identities.description: Array of valid identity uids. Identities represent different occupational verticals. To obtain a full list of identities, please contact support

in_setup.description: Whether the business is in setup mode

intents.description: List of modules the business wishes to use in the product from this list: ["accept_payments_tile", "documents_and_forms", "add_online_scheduling", "secure_portal_for_clients", "promotions", "manage_client_records"]

invite.description: Reference id to the marketing channel

is_template.description: Whether this account can be used as a template for creating more businesses

synchronized.description: When set to true, the business account is created synchronously. When set to false, the business account is created asynchronously - the request returns immediately after input parameters validation and an async job is created to handle the business account creation

note.description: An administrative note about the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

suggested_identities.description: List of suggested identities to tailor the business experience

tags.description: A list of comma-separated tags. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

template_business_id.description: Configure the newly created business similar to the provided business id

get.description: Validates username/password credentials for login. The API will be blocked for the username after 5 failed attempts.

parameters.description: Email address of the business owner (used as username for login)
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Password for the business owner account
parameters.name: password

200.description: Login credentials validated successfully. Returns authentication status indicating whether the provided username and password are valid.

post.description: This API performs entitlement verification for businesses seeking to register with a specific partner. It checks if a business meets the necessary criteria to qualify for partnership enrollment.

200.description: Audience claim validated successfully. Returns true if the business meets the necessary criteria to qualify for partnership enrollment with the specified partner.

unique_validation_identifier.description: The future business' unique validation identifier. This is an object containing validation criteria specific to the partner's requirements. The structure depends on the partner's configuration.

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific business by its ID, including admin account details and business information.

200.description: Business details retrieved successfully. Returns complete business information including admin account details and business data.

post.description: Updates an existing business. This endpoint allows updating business information, admin account details, integrations, and subscription plan. Only provided fields will be updated.

200.description: Business updated successfully. Returns the updated business information including admin account, business details, integrations, and subscription plan.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided for business update. The request contains invalid or missing required fields, or validation errors occurred.

404.description: Not Found - The specified business ID does not exist or you do not have permission to access it.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

scheduling_disabled.description: Business is not offering online scheduling through client portal

website_url.description: Businesss website URL. Must be a valid URL address including http/https.

external_id.description: Legacy, replaced by external_reference_id. It may also be referred to as a 'nickname'. Must contain at least one lowercase letter, can include numbers, and dots, at least 5 characters long, platform unique

200.description: Successfully retrieved directory branding information. Returns logo URL, color scheme (primary, secondary, text colors), directory name, and unique identifier.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

post.description: Creates a token for authentication. Tokens can be created for applications (app_id), businesses (business_id), or directories (directory_id). At least one identifier must be provided.

201.description: Token created successfully. Returns the generated authentication token that can be used for API access.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. At least one identifier (app_id, business_id, or directory_id) must be provided.

example.message: At least one identifier must be provided

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

404.description: Not Found - The specified app_id, business_id, or directory_id does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

app_id.description: A unique identifier for a 3rd party application.

business_id.description: A unique identifier for a business.

directory_id.description: A unique identifier for a partner.

post.description: Revoke token

201.description: Token revoked successfully. Returns confirmation that the specified token has been revoked and is no longer valid.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid token provided or token is already revoked.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

post.description:
Subscribe to webhook notifications. Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when specific events occur in the system. You must specify the entity (what object to monitor) and the event_type (what action triggers the notification).

**Common Entity and Event Type Combinations:**
- `business` + `create` - Notify when a business is created
- `account` + `rejected` - Notify when business creation fails (for asynchronous creation)
- `client` + `create` - Notify when a client is created
- `appointment` + `scheduled` - Notify when an appointment is scheduled
- `payment` + `recorded` - Notify when a payment is recorded
- `invoice` + `issued` - Notify when an invoice is issued

**Available Entities (40 total):**
- **Business Management:** `business`, `account`, `staff`, `location`, `service`
- **Client Management:** `client`, `lead`, `engagement`, `tag`
- **Scheduling:** `appointment`, `booking`, `meeting`, `event`, `event_attendance`, `cancellation`, `reschedule`, `confirmation`
- **Financial:** `payment`, `invoice`, `estimate`, `deposit`, `subscription`, `purchasable_subscription`
- **Communication:** `message`, `conversation`, `conversation_item`, `voice_call`, `notification`, `reminder`
- **Content:** `document`, `review`, `contact_form`
- **Integrations:** `application`, `app_subscription`, `payment_gateways_settings`, `voice_calls_settings`, `channel`
- **Other:** `bulk_import`, `matter`, `pivot`

**Available Event Types (35 total):**
- **Lifecycle Events:** `create`, `update`, `delete`
- **Status Changes:** `approved`, `rejected`, `closed`, `completed`, `done`, `deactivated`, `reactivated`
- **Scheduling Events:** `scheduled`, `cancelled`, `rescheduled`, `no_show`
- **Financial Events:** `paid`, `refunded`, `recorded`, `issued`
- **Communication Events:** `sent`, `read`, `business_sent_message`, `client_sent_message`, `reminder_sent`
- **Integration Events:** `installed`, `uninstalled`, `connected`, `disconnected`, `changed_primary_payment_gateway`
- **Other Events:** `event`, `status`, `submitted`, `matched`, `requested`, `recover`, `promotional_blocked`

Note: Not all entity/event_type combinations are valid. Refer to the webhook documentation for valid combinations.

201.description: Webhook subscription created successfully. Returns a subscription_id that can be used to identify this subscription.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. The entity/event_type combination may be invalid, the URL format is incorrect, or required fields are missing.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

entity.description: The entity (object type) to monitor for webhook events. This determines what type of object the webhook will track. Available entities include: 'business' (business accounts), 'client' (client records), 'appointment' (scheduled appointments), 'payment' (payment transactions), 'invoice' (invoices), 'account' (account-related events like business creation failures), and 34 other entity types. See the enum list below for all available entities.

event_type.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook notification. This specifies what action or state change should trigger the webhook. Common event types include: 'create' (object created), 'update' (object updated), 'delete' (object deleted), 'scheduled' (appointment/event scheduled), 'cancelled' (appointment/event cancelled), 'rejected' (request rejected, e.g., business creation failure), 'paid' (payment received), 'recorded' (payment recorded), 'issued' (invoice/estimate issued), 'sent' (message sent), and 25 other event types. See the enum list below for all available event types.

url.description: Where to send the webhook response to (e.g. https://my.domain.com/path/of/webhook/call). Must be a valid HTTPS URL.

post.description: Unsubscribe from webhook. Note: This endpoint uses legacy parameter names ('event' and 'target_url'). The 'target_url' must match exactly the URL used when subscribing. The 'event' parameter is optional and can be used to unsubscribe from a specific event type.

event.description: Object / Event name to unsubscribe from (optional). If not provided, all subscriptions for the target_url will be removed.

target_url.description: The webhook URL that was used when subscribing. Must match exactly the URL used during subscription.

get.description: Get webhooks list

parameters.description:
Filtering the list of webhooks.
Filter is a 'deepObject' works with:
  1. 'entity' - object which listen to event (example: client)
  2. 'event_type' - type of event to trigger webhook (example: created)

Example:
  <url>?filter[entity]=client&filter[event_type]=created
parameters.name: filter

entity.description: Object / Event name that the webhook is subscribed to. This is the entity type being monitored. Available entities include: 'business' (business accounts), 'client' (client records), 'appointment' (scheduled appointments), 'payment' (payment transactions), 'invoice' (invoices), 'account' (account-related events), and 34 other entity types. See the enum list below for all available entities.

event_type.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook notification. This specifies what action or state change triggers the webhook. Common event types include: 'create' (object created), 'update' (object updated), 'delete' (object deleted), 'scheduled' (appointment/event scheduled), 'cancelled' (appointment/event cancelled), 'rejected' (request rejected), 'paid' (payment received), 'recorded' (payment recorded), 'issued' (invoice/estimate issued), 'sent' (message sent), and 25 other event types. See the enum list below for all available event types.

get.description: Retrieves a list of features enabled for a specific business. Features represent capabilities and modules available to the business.

bundled.description: Bundled items count or identifier. Represents items that are included as part of a bundle package.

type.description: Type of purchased items being updated. This categorizes the items (e.g., 'features', 'modules', 'addons').

post.description:
Create a new role for a business

Available for **Staff Tokens**

code.description: A unique readable code for the role

name.description: The role name as it's presented in the UI. By default, it will be assigned from the original permission, but can be overridden for a specific business

description.description: The role description as its presented in the UI. By default, it will be assigned from the original permission, but can be overridden for a specific business

permissions.description: A list of permissions that are assigned to the role by default

key.description: The unique identifier (key) of the Permission

allow.description: A flag indicating if this permission is by default assigned to the role

is_editable.description: A flag to indicate if the role can be edited by the business. By default, system roles are not editable. Can not be changed after creation

example.name: Admin
example.description: Admin role. Typically has access to all features in the system

put.description:
Update a Staff Permission Overrides List based on staff UID and a list of permissions. The list supplied will append new permissions and override exsiting permissions assigned to this staff.

Available for **Staff Tokens**

parameters.name: staff_uid
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the staff member

key.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the Permission

state.description: allow, deny or inherit. When inherit is used, the permission override is removed and the default permission from the BusinessRole is used

delete.description:
Removes all assigned overrides based on a staff member's unique identifier (staff_uid).

This will return user to its original Business Role defaults

Available for **Staff Tokens**

parameters.name: staff_uid
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the staff member

get.summary: Get all Staff Permission Overrides Lists
get.description:
Get a list of all StaffPermissionOverrideList in the business (if used by a user that has permissions to view and manage permissions to staff in the business)

Available for **Staff Tokens**

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: How many items to return per page. Max: 100

get.description:
Get a list of staff Permissions. You must filter the list using a list of permissions keys
Used to validate if a user can or can not access features

Available for **Staff Tokens**

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A list of unique identifier of the Permissions you wish to check

Retrieve business branding, or directory branding when business branding is unavailable. **Available for Staff Tokens**

delete.description: Remove business identities. **Available for Staff Tokens**

parameters.description: A unique identifer of the business. Can be the Business UID or nickname\external ID
parameters.name: X-On-Behalf-Of

identities.description: Identities to add to business or a single identity of verti

get.description: Retrieve business identities. **Available for Staff Tokens**

parameters.description: A unique identifer of the business. Can be the Business UID or nickname\external ID
parameters.name: X-On-Behalf-Of

put.description:
Add business identities to optimize the business terminology, settings, and content
* The provided identities must exist in the system
* Each call adds the provided identities to the list of identities already set for the business
 * Provide one identity only when running Verti. Providing multiple identities will fail.
* For best practice, when creating an account, do one of the following:
  1. Don't assign an identity - when not assigning an identity, Verti uses the default identity content and settings. Later, when re-running Verti with an identity, it will overwrite the account settings and content with the provided identity settings and will append its content.
  2. Assign the account an identity that was marked as "Generic" - Verti only clones its content and not the settings. Later when re-running Verti, it will add the additional identity's content and settings. **Available for Staff Tokens**

parameters.description: A unique identifer of the business. Can be the Business UID or nickname\external ID
parameters.name: X-On-Behalf-Of

execute_verti.description: Re-runs Verti when set to true

identities.description: Identities to add to business or a single identity of verti

get.description:
Get an account's activity report for the last 3 months, including the following information:
  1. Number of payments received
  2. Number of conversations started
  3. Number of bookings, including appointments booked and event attendance
  4. Number of campaigns created
  5. Number of documents shared by the business
  6. Total Number of clients
Note: Currently, the API has a rate limit of 1 request per 5 seconds. Results are cached for 24 hours **Available for Staff Tokens**

bookings.description: Total number of bookings in the last 3 months

campaigns.description: Total number of campaigns in the last 3 months

conversations.description: Total number of conversations in the last 3 months

documents.description: Total number of documents in the last 3 months

payments.description: Total number of payments in the last 3 months

get.summary: Business account usage in the last 3 months

get.description: Get daily sign-in records for the business's staff members within a specified date range

parameters.description:
Required filter by date range. Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `filter[start_date][eq]=2000-01-01&filter[end_date][eq]=2000-02-01`.
The results include both the start and end dates, with a maximum range of 31 days.
parameters.name: filter

errors.message: start_date field must be a valid date parameter. Example, 2000-01-30

parameters.description: A unique identifer of the business. Can be the Business UID or nickname\external ID
parameters.name: X-On-Behalf-Of

parameters.description: User id of the staff to be updated
parameters.name: uid

display_name.description: Staff display name. No longer than 255 characters, no HTML or new lines.

email.description: Staff email. Valid email format, unique email.

first_name.description: Staff first name. No longer than 255 characters, no HTML or new lines.

last_name.description: Staff last name. No longer than 255 characters, no HTML or new lines.

role.description: Please use the new Access Control API: https://developers.intandem.tech/v3.0/docs/main-concepts

sms_notifications_on.description: Staff SMS notifications on/off. A valid value [true/false].

type.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **package**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; *addon**: for additional products like SMS, staff_seat and module.

SKU.description: The unique code of the single SKU this offering represents. Offerings support exactly one SKU; to combine multiple SKUs, use a bundledOffering or similar higher-level abstraction.

quantity.description: The number of items included in the offering

payment_type.description: The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering,**external**: Payment is not done by the platform (typically an API call from the partner), **free**: No payment is required; **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering; **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis; **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis; **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscriptio. If an offeing is defined as bundled it can not be sold as a separated subscription

is_active.description: Current status of the directory offering

vendor.description: The business entity or vendor that offers this SKU.

currency.description: The currency used for the price. Supported currencies: USD; EUR; GBP.

trial.description: Number of days for the trial period. If not specified or set to 0, it indicates no trial period is offered.

reporting_tags.description: A list of tags to be used for reporting purposes

currency.description: The currency used for the price

trial.description: Number of days for the trial period. If not specified or set to 0, it indicates no trial period is offered.

is_active.description: Current status of the directory offering

reporting_tags.description: A list of tags to be used for reporting purposes

directory_offerings.description: List of newly created DirectoryOfferings (for bulk creation)

bundldedOfferings.description: List of newly created BundldedOfferings (for bulk creation)

directory_uid.description: Unique identifier for a directory. Defines which directory is authorized to sell this Offering.

offering_uid.description: Unique identifier for an Offering. Defines an offering the directory is authorized to sell.
Unique identifier of the offering which the bundled item is being added to
The underlying directory offering uid. Must be a valid offering_uid either from vcita or from the offering GET API.

purchase_currency.description: The purchase currency at the moment of the subscription was created. Supported currencies: USD; EUR; GBP

price.description: Optional. The actual amount charged to the customer. When provided, this overrides the standard offering price. This parameter is restricted to directory/admin tokens only and requires payment_type to be 'external'. When price is provided, the system stores both original_price (from the offering) and price (the discounted amount).

discount_code_name.description: Optional. String identifier for the coupon/discount type (e.g., 'percent', 'fixed_amount'). Used for tracking and reporting purposes.

coupon_code.description: Optional. Discount identifier used for tracking and Recurly integration. This is the coupon code that will be applied to the subscription.

payment_type.description: The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering. When price override is used, this must be set to 'external'. **external**: Payment is not done by the platform (typically an API call from the partner); **free**: No payment is required; **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering; **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis; **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis; **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscription

purchase_state.description: The requested purchase state of the subscription. If expired is selected, the expiration_date is ignored and current date will be used. If canceled is selected, the expiration_date must be provided. Note that is_active is dymanically calculated based on status and expiration_date

expiration_date.description: The date to expire the subscription. Should be in ISO8601 format (e.g., 2023-10-01T00:00:00Z) and at least one day in the future. Use 'expired' purchase_state if you want to immediately expire the subscription.

unique_code.description: The unique identifier of the Permission

name.description: The name of the permission shown to the user in English

description.description: The description of the permission shown to the user in English

code.description: A unique readable code for the role

description.example: Admin role. Typically has access to all features in the system

capabilities.description: A list of permissions that are assigned to the role

items.description: The unique code of the OperatorCapability

code.description: A unique readable code for the role

description.example: Admin role. Typically has access to all features in the system

capabilities.description: A list of permissions that are assigned to the role

items.description: The unique code of the OperatorCapability

operator_uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the Operator

op_role_uid.description: A unique identifier (UID) of the associated OPRole

acting_as_uid.description: The unique id of the staff/operator acting as. Either operator uid when acting as the operator, or staff uid when acting on behalf of a staff member

acting_as.description: The type of the entity the Operator is acting as, operator - acting as the operator; staff - acting on behlaf of a staff member

staff_quick_action_lists.description: List of staff quick action lists

first_name.description: The first name of the staff member

last_name.description: The last name of the staff member

display_name.description: The display name of the staff member

email.description: The email address of the staff member

professional_title.description: The professional title of the staff member

country_name.description: The country name for the staff member's mobile number

mobile_number.description: The mobile number of the staff member without country code

photo_url.description: The URL to the staff member's profile photo

default_homepage.description: Default homepage when the staff member logs in

email_signature.description: The email signature of the staff member

success.description: Whether the API request was successful

tags.name: Offering
tags.description: The offering API facilitates seamless CRUD operations, allowing staff to create, retrieve, update, and delete offering items, and related entities with ease.
